string: ACT I
SCENE I. The king of Navarre's park.
Enter FERDINAND king of Navarre, BIRON, LONGAVILLE and DUMAIN
FERDINAND
speaker: FERDINAND

string: Let fame, that all hunt after in their lives,
speaker: FERDINAND

string: Live register'd upon our brazen tombs
speaker: FERDINAND

string: And then grace us in the disgrace of death;
speaker: FERDINAND

string: When, spite of cormorant devouring Time,
speaker: FERDINAND

string: The endeavor of this present breath may buy
speaker: FERDINAND

string: That honour which shall bate his scythe's keen edge
speaker: FERDINAND

string: And make us heirs of all eternity.
speaker: FERDINAND

string: Therefore, brave conquerors,--for so you are,
speaker: FERDINAND

string: That war against your own affections
speaker: FERDINAND

string: And the huge army of the world's desires,--
speaker: FERDINAND

string: Our late edict shall strongly stand in force:
speaker: FERDINAND

string: Navarre shall be the wonder of the world;
speaker: FERDINAND

string: Our court shall be a little Academe,
speaker: FERDINAND

string: Still and contemplative in living art.
speaker: FERDINAND

string: You three, Biron, Dumain, and Longaville,
speaker: FERDINAND

speaker: FERDINAND

speaker: FERDINAND

speaker: FERDINAND

speaker: FERDINAND

string: As bright Apollo's lute, strung with his hair:
speaker: BIRON

string: And when Love speaks, the voice of all the gods
speaker: BIRON

string: Makes heaven drowsy with the harmony.
speaker: BIRON

string: Never durst poet touch a pen to write
speaker: BIRON

string: Until his ink were temper'd with Love's sighs;
speaker: BIRON

string: O, then his lines would ravish savage ears
speaker: BIRON

string: And plant in tyrants mild humility.
speaker: BIRON

string: From women's eyes this doctrine I derive:
speaker: BIRON

string: They sparkle still the right Promethean fire;
speaker: BIRON

string: They are the books, the arts, the academes,
speaker: BIRON

string: That show, contain and nourish all the world:
speaker: BIRON

string: Else none at all in ought proves excellent.
speaker: BIRON

string: Then fools you were these women to forswear,
speaker: BIRON

string: Or keeping what is sworn, you will prove fools.
speaker: BIRON

string: For wisdom's sake, a word that all men love,
speaker: BIRON

string: Or for love's sake, a word that loves all men,
speaker: BIRON

string: Or for men's sake, the authors of these women,
speaker: BIRON

string: Or women's sake, by whom we men are men,
speaker: BIRON

string: Let us once lose our oaths to find ourselves,
speaker: BIRON

string: Or else we lose ourselves to keep our oaths.
speaker: BIRON

string: It is religion to be thus forsworn,
speaker: BIRON

string: For charity itself fulfills the law,
speaker: BIRON

string: And who can sever love from charity?
speaker: BIRON

string: And therewithal to win me, if you please,
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Without the which I am not to be won,
speaker: ROSALINE

string: You shall this twelvemonth term from day to day
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Visit the speechless sick and still converse
speaker: ROSALINE

string: With groaning wretches; and your task shall be,
speaker: ROSALINE

string: With all the fierce endeavor of your wit
speaker: ROSALINE

string: To enforce the pained impotent to smile.
speaker: ROSALINE

string: BIRON
speaker: BIRON

string: To move wild laughter in the throat of death?
speaker: BIRON

string: It cannot be; it is impossible:
speaker: BIRON

string: Mirth cannot move a soul in agony.
speaker: BIRON

string: ROSALINE
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Why, that's the way to choke a gibing spirit,
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Whose influence is begot of that loose grace
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Which shallow laughing hearers give to fools:
speaker: ROSALINE

string: A jest's prosperity lies in the ear
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Of him that hears it, never in the tongue
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Of him that makes it: then, if sickly ears,
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Deaf'd with the clamours of their own dear groans,
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Will hear your idle scorns, continue then,
speaker: ROSALINE

string: And I will have you and that fault withal;
speaker: ROSALINE

string: But if they will not, throw away that spirit,
speaker: ROSALINE

string: And I shall find you empty of that fault,
speaker: ROSALINE

string: Right joyful of your reformation.
speaker: ROSALINE

string: BIRON
speaker: BIRON

string: A twelvemonth! well; befall what will befall,
speaker: BIRON

string: I'll jest a twelvemonth in an hospital.
speaker: BIRON
